pr_title: [ML] Remove top level importance from classification inference results

timeline.body:
couldn't this blow up? we need to somehow require that `importance` here is not null.

I think the way to do that is to run 
```
            classImportance.stream().mapToDouble(ClassImportance::getImportance).map(Math::abs).sum()
```
if it is null. If classImportance is null && importance is null, then maybe just return a 0.0

I think the way to do that is to run

timeline.author: benwtrent

timeline.message: Handle serialization of importance when null

[ML] Remove top level importance from classification inference results

As we have decided top level importance for classification is not useful,
it has been removed from the results from the training job. This commit
also removes them from inference.
Handle serialization of importance when null
Split feature importance to separate classes per analysis
Split feature importance to separate classes per analysis

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertThat(document.getFieldValue("ml.my_processor.feature_importance.0.classes.0.class_name", Double.class), equalTo("class_a"));
assertThat(document.getFieldValue("ml.my_processor.feature_importance.0.classes.0.class_name", String.class), equalTo("class_a"));
